intro: Derris lasiopetala, commonly known as the hairy leaf derris, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family, characterized by its pod-bearing fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant features compound leaves with hairy surfaces, giving it its common name, and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in racemes. Its roots contain a variety of alkaloids, some of which have been studied for potential medicinal properties. Derris lasiopetala is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a range of environmental conditions.
